etymologies: late Middle English (in an earlier sense). From Middle French merele, merelle, feminine (late 11th cent in Old French; French marelle, and marel, merel, masculine, both probably from an unattested Romance base *marr- stone, rock

definitions: In plural form (formerly also in singular form). The game of nine men's morris.

notes.text: Sometimes with preceding word or words indicating the number and type of counters used, as "nine men's merels", "ninepenny merels", etc.
